sourcing.instructions: Cs: Obtain from a chemical supplier specializing in alkali metals. Mo: Available from metal suppliers or chemical warehouses. Nb: Sourced from specialty metal vendors. Tc: Acquire from nuclear material suppliers (ensure proper licensing). Te: Obtain from chemical suppliers or electronics manufacturers.
steps: Cs: Obtain from a chemical supplier specializing in alkali metals. Mo: Available from metal suppliers or chemical warehouses. Nb: Sourced from specialty metal vendors. Tc: Acquire from nuclear material suppliers (ensure proper licensing). Te: Obtain from chemical suppliers or electronics manufacturers.

1. Weigh each ingredient using an analytical balance for accuracy. 2. In a clean, dry environment, combine Cs, Mo, Nb, Tc, and Te in a ceramic mixing bowl. 3. Use a pestle and mortar to thoroughly blend the powders until a uniform mixture is achieved. 4. Transfer the mixture into a pre-cleaned crucible made of alumina or similar material.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh each ingredient using an analytical balance for accuracy. 2. In a clean, dry environment, combine Cs, Mo, Nb, Tc, and Te in a ceramic mixing bowl. 3. Use a pestle and mortar to thoroughly blend the powders until a uniform mixture is achieved. 4. Transfer the mixture into a pre-cleaned crucible made of alumina or similar material.

steps: 1. Place the crucible in a high-temperature furnace. 2. Heat the mixture to 800°C (1472°F) at a rate of 10°C per minute. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction and solidification of the material.
heating.raw_text: 1. Place the crucible in a high-temperature furnace. 2. Heat the mixture to 800°C (1472°F) at a rate of 10°C per minute. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction and solidification of the material.

steps: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool to room temperature naturally without opening the door (approximately 6-8 hours). 2. Once the furnace reaches ambient temperature, carefully remove the crucible.
cooling.raw_text: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool to room temperature naturally without opening the door (approximately 6-8 hours). 2. Once the furnace reaches ambient temperature, carefully remove the crucible.

steps: 1. Remove the solidified sample from the crucible, taking care to avoid any fractures. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the sample into desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 3. Sand the edges and surfaces with 400-grit sandpaper to achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a sealant to enhance durability and prevent oxidation.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Remove the solidified sample from the crucible, taking care to avoid any fractures. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the sample into desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 3. Sand the edges and surfaces with 400-grit sandpaper to achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a sealant to enhance durability and prevent oxidation.
